reviews.review_msg: Psych 201w with Shawn Tan is by far one of the easiest courses. You don't need to attend the lectures asides from the first ones just to get a general idea of the course.This course is tutorial based so attend your tutorials !! This is one of the courses that if you follow the instructions and put a bit of effort, then you will get an A.
Lectures seemed pretty pointless which was good because they were awful. Your TA is really all that matters for this course.

His lectures are clear and is easy to follow. He assigns quizzes every week, so get ready to read the textbook. During lectures he gives good feedback on quiz questions that most people got wrong. Attendance is not mandatory for the lecture as he hosts a zoom call that is also recorded and uploaded. Overall, nice prof.
I was worried about this course but it ended up being very straightforward and fair graded, the prof wants everyone to do well and if you complete the coursework you will do just fine

Psyc 201w with Dr.Tan was awesome, he was very accommodating to all students and was super nice. I was very afraid for this class but it was so easy and the grading criteria is painfully detailed and clear. If you follow all the instructions for the assignments, do your research participation, and do the weekly quizzes, you will get an A.
While the lecture slides may not be the most fun, this grading criteria is super clear and if you follow what he says you will get an A in the class.

I took this class online in 2020. I would recommend taking it online if you can! Cause in person you actually have to conduct the experiment. The lectures were dry but the midterms and final were easy because he gave you the terms that are on them. However, it's your TA that makes a huge difference in this PSYC class cause they grade ur paper.

He has a strong accent when explaining stuff but he recorded lectures so we could look at them to see what we missed. You only needed to be in-person for tutorials as he streams in-person lectures over zoom. I never used the "required" textbook. He struggles the most explaining concepts involving math but for the rest he explains them adequately.

Dr.Tan is a great person, but he has a strong accent which makes him hard to understand. On top of that, he is not very good at explaining concepts as he pretty much gives textbook definitions. The quizzes for this class are easy though and there was no midterm or final.

Shawn tan is a good professor. Sometimes it can be hard to understand him but his slides are clear and he is very clear about the structure of the assessments and what will be on there. The assessments come directly from the slides. He records his lectures which I love and in-person attendance isn't mandatory.

Professor Tan is a nice person, but his explanations of certain concepts are unclear and confusing. He also has difficulty answering student questions during lectures. Student participation is expected during lectures, which leaves the room quiet. But, his lecture slides are always posted, and his notes are clear.

Horrible. He's a nice guy but not a good professor. He could not explain was he was teaching well. Class attendance was always at 50% or less. The way grading is done is not helpful and doesn't actually show if you know the material or not. Would not recommend at all.
